title: Sigma Notation
text: We express a sigma notation using the initial number as a lower bound and the ending number as an upper bound. The expression is given in this case sum{i\=1}{200}{(i-3)**2}
speech: We express a sigma notation using the initial number as a lower bound and the ending number as an upper bound. The expression is given in this case sum{i\=1}{200}{(i-3)**2}
pacedSpeech: We express a sigma notation using the initial number as a lower bound and the ending number as an upper bound. The expression is given in this case sum{i\=1}{200}{(i-3)**2}

title: Expand
text: According to the expansion of the perfect square formula, the summation can be written as sum{i\=1}{200}{(i**2)-(6*i)+9}
speech: According to the expansion of the perfect square formula, the summation can be written as sum{i\=1}{200}{(i**2)-(6*i)+9}
pacedSpeech: According to the expansion of the perfect square formula, the summation can be written as sum{i\=1}{200}{(i**2)-(6*i)+9}

title: Properties of Sigma Notation
text: How can we separate the resulting three terms using the properties of sigma notation?
